bug.author: amiltonwong
bug.description:
Hi, all, I had followed the installation steps (conda virtual environment), and installed MinkowskiEngine successfully. However, when I run python examples/example.py, I got the following error: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "examples/example.py", line 5, in <module> import MinkowskiEngine as ME File "/root/anaconda3/envs/pytorch1.1/lib/python3.6/site-packages/MinkowskiEngine-0.2.4-py3.6-linux-x86_64.egg/MinkowskiEngine/__init__.py", line 12, in <module> from SparseTensor import SparseTensor File "/root/anaconda3/envs/pytorch1.1/lib/python3.6/site-packages/MinkowskiEngine-0.2.4-py3.6-linux-x86_64.egg/MinkowskiEngine/SparseTensor.py", line 6, in <module> from MinkowskiCoords import CoordsKey, CoordsManager File "/root/anaconda3/envs/pytorch1.1/lib/python3.6/site-packages/MinkowskiEngine-0.2.4-py3.6-linux-x86_64.egg/MinkowskiEngine/MinkowskiCoords.py", line 4, in <module> import MinkowskiEngineBackend as MEB ImportError: /root/anaconda3/envs/pytorch1.1/lib/python3.6/site-packages/MinkowskiEngine-0.2.4-py3.6-linux-x86_64.egg/MinkowskiEngineBackend.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so: undefined symbol: cblas_dgemm </denchmark-code>
It seems something wrong or missing related to cblas_dgemm. Could you suggest me how to fix it? THX! PS. my system config: ubuntu 16.04 python 3.6 pytorch 1.1

comments.comment:
Thanks for reporting the issue. Please follow the instruction and let me know the result?
Install openblas by conda install openblas in your environment. edit line 33 of the Makefile to BLAS := open. edit line 62 of the setup.py to libraries=['minkowski', 'openblas'], Go to the root directory of the MinkowskiEngine. Type make clean Type python setup.py install.

I submitted a fix for it. Ignore the previous comment and follow the following instruction.
go to the root directory of the Minkowski Engine. Type git pull Type make clean Type python setup.py install.
If it doesn't solve the issue, please let me know.
It seems like anaconda does not provide shared libraries for atlas. Since atlas is not actively maintained, I am switching to openblas. Also, anaconda provides shared libraries for it as well.
